Classical.Structure: The light-sensitive layer of tissue at the back of the inner eye. Contains photoreceptor cells (rods and cones).
Classical.Function: Detects light and converts it into neural signals. Performs initial visual processing (e.g., edge detection, motion detection).
Classical.Pathology: Retinal detachment, macular degeneration, retinitis pigmentosa.

SCPN.L1_QuantumBiological: The site of primary quantum transduction. Photoreceptor cells (rods/cones) use quantum effects (e.g., photoisomerization of rhodopsin) to convert a single photon into a macroscopic neural signal.
SCPN.L2_NeurochemicalNeurological: A 3-layer neural network (photoreceptors, bipolar cells, ganglion cells) that processes the quantum signal into a compressed, classical spike train (action potentials).
SCPN.L3_GenomicEpigeneticMorphogenetic: The morphogenetic development of the retina is a key example of L3 processes forming a complex L1/L2 sensor.
SCPN.L4_CellularTissueSynchronisation: Formalizes tissue-level dynamics via phase-coupled oscillators, quasicritical operation (Griffiths regimes), and multi-path coupling (gap junctions, ephaptic fields, glial/vascular slow control). Models entrainment to cosmological rhythms (Schumann, lunar) via biophotons and cryptochromes.
SCPN.L5_OrganismalPsychoemotional: The 'sensor' for the L5 visual model. Provides the raw data stream that the visual cortex (L3.Brain.VisualCortex) will render.
SCPN.L6_PlanetaryEcological: The primary sensor for L6 light cycles, providing the input signal for the SCN (L3.Brain.SCN) via melanopsin-containing ganglion cells.
SCPN.L8_CosmicEntrainment: Acts as the sensor for L8 solar rhythms.

Symbolic.MetaphysicalMapping: The 'lens' of the soul, where the 'light' of the outer world (photons) is transduced into the 'light' of the inner world (neural signals).

Falsification_Hypotheses: Rods and cones will be shown to be insensitive to single-photon events.
The retina will be shown to be a passive sensor, performing no local computation or signal processing.
Experimental_Protocols: Electroretinography (ERG) to measure retinal electrical responses to light.
Single-cell recording from ganglion cells to map their receptive fields (e.g., center-surround).
Simulation_Suite: Model the photoisomerization cascade in a rod cell.
Simulate a 3-layer retinal network to produce center-surround receptive fields.
